definition: namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Even if we are caught in such a situation, we should not despair.
sentences.chinese: 但即令我們碰到這種情況，也不應絕望。

sentences.english: Emperor Xian commanded Zhong Yao to draft the edict confirming Cao Cao’s elevation to king of Wei.
sentences.chinese: 獻帝即令鍾繇草詔，冊立曹操爲魏王。

sentences.english: He has little, if any, money.
sentences.chinese: 他即令有錢，也是很少的。

sentences.english: But even lions and lambs find common ground.
sentences.chinese: 但是即令獅子和羔羊也能找到共同的基礎。

sentences.english: And if anyone tries to persuade me, even the King himself.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人來勸我，即令是國王親自來。

sentences.english: Even the slightest error could cause great harm.
sentences.chinese: 即令最小的錯誤都可能造成大害。

definition: entirely/without exception/(literary) to be together/to be alike
to indulge/to give free rein/even if
that being the case/then/in that case
